alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 2:28PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Snow showers with embedded snow squalls may impact the evening commute in northeastern New York and Vermont... Snow squalls are possible late this afternoon in the heaviest showers as a cold front moves across Vermont. Affected locations will see rapidly changing weather and road conditions...with brief heavy snow and gusty winds. Visibilities below 1 mile are expected and possibly below a half mile in rare instances. A quick accumulation of snow up to an inch is possible. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Be prepared for areas of blowing snow. This could lead to rapidly changing conditions and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions...reduce speed and make sure headlights are on. Icy roads are possible...producing hazardous travel conditions. If you must travel, please use caution.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
